title: I Don't Understand the Rank Mechanic.
body:
So played 2 games, both in normies, both as the same champ in the same role, against roughly the same tier of opponent 1 after the other, both last around the same amount of time (within 4 minutes)

The first game I get a 12 KDA, 66% kill participation (with kills being about 1/5th), around 40% of the damage share, good cs for role and a good vision score, get an S+
Second game, I get a 33 KDA with less deaths, 80% Kill participation (with kills being over 1/4), around 40% damage share, higher cs and vision score, get an A+

second game would have higher DPM (26k for shorter game, 36k for 4 minutes longer) and provided more shielding as team required more.

I just don't understand.

The only thing I can possibly think of is my CS in game 2 was 53 compared to 21 in game 1, only because the waveclear was needed in a number of 5v2 sieges... which we held off and saved turret. So I'm a support playing lux who wards. Sue me.

That really shouldn't come into it, should it?

replies.body:
In the A+ game, you killed 1 Outer Tower. In the S+ game, you killed 2 Inner Towers and an Inhib. You also dealt over 1k *less* damage to Towers in your A+ game than your S+ game. You destroyed more enemy wards (so more vision denial, and better use of your control wards) in the S+ game than your A+ game.

It may also be worth looking at heat maps of those games to see how you're roaming or if you happen to spend more time around mid/top (and possibly judged as Top Lux, for example).

This is basically all I could find. No guarantee that it's correct, but it might be something :D

you can probably notice from my vision scores that I'm constantly on the move, denying and placing vision. As far as I'm aware destroyed wards count towards your vision score, from testing, and when in one game they place a bunch less, the percentages remain about the same. Last hitting objectives like that I'm fairly certain don't, or at least shouldn't come into the equation. The damage itself sure, but not the last hits, 1000 less damage to objectives, especially as a support, really should not be an issue. All it does is persuade people to be more wreckless as a support so they get the last hits... if you have baroned up minions and all you need to do is protect the 3 cannons because their counter siege is better than your siege, you should be rewarded for being smart like that instead of penalized. Just seems stupid to place emphasis on statistics that are largely irrelevant in many games.
